block.p: Nina Danielle Bauer, the daughter of Binnie and Jay A. Bauer of Palm Beach, Fla., was married last Monday to Andrew L. Shapiro, a son of Ellen and Daniel S. Shapiro of New York. Rabbi Peter J. Rubinstein officiated at the Elk Mountain Lodge in Aspen, Colo.

The bride, 29, is a partner in IvyWise Kids, consultants in New York who advise parents on their children's schooling. She graduated from the University of Pennsylvania and received a master's degree in early childhood education from New York University. The bride's father owns Seaman Schepps, a jewelry company that has stores in New York and Palm Beach and on Nantucket Island.

The bride, 29, is a partner in IvyWise Kids, consultants in New York who advise parents on their children's schooling. She graduated from the University of Pennsylvania and received a master's degree in early childhood education from New York University. The bride's father owns Seaman Schepps, a jewelry company that has stores in New York and Palm Beach and on Nantucket Island.

The bridegroom, 32, is a contributing editor to The Nation magazine and the author of ''The Control Revolution: How the Internet Is Putting Individuals in Charge and Changing the World We Know'' (PublicAffairs, 1999). He is also an owner of GreenOrder, a company that uses the Internet to promote environmentally sound business practices. He graduated from Brown and received his law degree from Yale, where he is to become a visiting lecturer on Internet policy in January. His father is a founding partner in Shulte Roth & Zabel, a law firm in New York, and was the president of the UJA-Federation of New York from 1983 to 1986. The bridegroom's mother is a volunteer arts educator in the New York City public schools.
